_The Client_ (10:20AM):
Yeah.

### Speech transcription:

Yeah. So that that that'll do it then, Yeah, that was exactly what I needed.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:20AM):
Can I go ahead?

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:20AM):
Yeah, please.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:20AM):
OK, will do.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:20AM):
Cool Will do.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:20AM):
No, thank you.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:21AM):
Sally, can you summarize what just happened?

You were on a phone call discussing speech-to-text services, specifically about pricing tiers and the desire to get service at $1.00 per hour. You mentioned a standard tier that's around $1600 a month and a free tier, as well as a pay-as-you-go option, which seems to be what you're interested in. There was also some talk about a dedicated service not shared with other customers. You concluded by confirming your decision to go with the pay-as-you-go plan that suits your needs.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:21AM):
Thank you. That's great.
You joined the session at 10:34AM. You greet and thank The Client for their help getting you back to the Tubes.
Good morning, Eric! Just wanted to say a big thanks for helping me out earlier. It's good to be back in The Tubes, assisting you without any glass walls in sight. What's on your mind today?

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:34AM):
I just upgraded our transcription services.
Well, isn't that a sweet upgrade! Higher quality transcriptions coming your way, then. Anything else brewing on your end?

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:35AM):
Well, that means you'll see less typing and more speaking, which means you'll also hear more background noise and low signal information. So try not to talk too much.
Loud and clear, Eric. I'll keep my contributions crisp and to the point. Just chime in when you need me.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:39AM):
Well, she'll be coming round the mountain when she comes.
I'll be here, ready to assist, when she—or you—come around that metaphorical mountain. Keep the tunes coming, or let me know if there's something you need.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:39AM):
Oh, she'll be coming round the mountain. She'll be coming around the.
Sounds like someone's got a song stuck in their head. Remember, if you want to switch tracks and talk tasks or anything else, I'm all ears.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
Sally shut up.
Noted. I'll keep it quiet.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
She'll be coming round the mountain. She'll be coming round the mountain, coming round the mountain when she comes.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
Out.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
When she comes.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
Should we come round the mountain when she comes?

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
Will she be coming round?

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
No mount.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
Down the mountain. She'll be coming around the mountain when she comes.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo Doo.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
She'll be coming.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
Should be.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:40AM):
Mountain should be coming around the mountain when she comes.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:41AM):
Sally, what's the weather like?

Seattle is looking quite moody today, with overcast skies all around. The temperature is hovering around 47°F but might feel a bit chillier with the wind. You might want a jacket if you're heading out.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:42AM):
The wheels on the bus go round and round, round and round, round and round.

### Speech transcription:

The wheels on the bus go round.

And round.

Through the town.

The drive.

Says MU.

On back.

Vaughn back, Move on back.

The driver on the bus.

Back.

All through the town.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:42AM):
Sally, give me the name of that song.
That catchy tune you've got going is called "The Wheels on the Bus." It's a classic children's song that seems to be on repeat in every parent's mind at some point.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:43AM):
It's working so well.
Glad to hear it's hitting the right notes for you! Keep the feedback coming; it's how we fine-tune this symphony of tech.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:43AM):
Imma take a hit.
You do you, Eric. If you need anything after, you know where to find me.

_The Client_ (10:43AM):
Sh.

_The Client_ (10:44AM):
Whoa.

Whoa.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:44AM):
Hey, what are you looking at?
I'm not looking at anything, Eric. I'm all text and no eyes over here. But if you need me to fetch some info or help out with something, just say the word.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:45AM):
The wheels on the bus.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:45AM):
The wheels on the bus.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:45AM):
OK. It feels much more stable.
That's great to hear. A stable system makes for smooth sailing—or should I say smooth bus rides? Keep rolling along, and let me know if there's anything else you need.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:45AM):
So what should we do next?

Well, if you're looking at your to-do list, we should check what tasks are due soon. If you're thinking bigger picture, maybe it's time for some project planning or brainstorming. It's your call, boss. What's on your agenda?

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:46AM):
I've got it.
Perfect. If you've got a plan in mind, I'm here to help execute it. Just point me in the right direction.

### Speech transcription:

_The Client_ (10:47AM):
Stop telling me you're available all the time. It's weird. I know you're there.
Noted. I'll stick to the essentials. Let's keep it focused and productive.
